If that doesn't work, we will get an update out soon to stop it from happening.

Developer_Reply: Thanks for the great review, Jami! And thanks for the heads up about the lagging. Feel free to email us at taxhelp@stridehealth.com with the email that you used to create your account, and we can look into this for you. -Sarah from Stride

Name: Simon Webb

Name: Seth Smith
Comments: Is there a way to turn on stride in my notification bar? I used to be able to see my mileage on my notification bar. It doesn't show it anymore and I keep forgetting to turn my mileage off when I'm done driving.

You may have none enabled, or specific channels disabled. Our next update is also making some updates to the notifications that should make them work even better.

Name: Samantha Young
Comments: I can't find an option to automatically track miles
Developer_Reply: Stride only records mileage when you tell it to. You'll need to click the blue "+" button on the Tax Savings screen of your app, and then click "Track miles." For automatic notifications that will remind you to start a drive, you'll need to move faster than 5mph and have your phone plugged in and charging, the app will then send the notification.

I know it’s inconvenient, but this helps improve the tracking quality. Note we are working towards making this better! We would appreciate it if you could send us details at taxhelp@stridehealth.com.

Developer_Reply: Thank you for reporting, and sorry for the trouble. We just released a version to fix the issue, so please update as soon as you're able, and you should be able to get going again. Let us know if you run into any other issues - we're happy to help!

Name: Cody Winter
Comments: All it does is crash every time I try to open the app.
Developer_Reply: Sorry about that, and thanks for letting us know that you saw this. We've found the bug, and we'll be getting a new update out tonight to resolve it as soon as possible. Edit: We've given the new version to Google, so it should be available on your device soon. Sorry again! Let us know if you have any other issues.

Name: Matt C.
Comments: Now they've done away with using actual expenses because you can no longer enter gas or maintenance and you can no longer add notes for mileage tracked automatically.
Developer_Reply: Sorry for the trouble, we're making some changes to the drive tracking, so we'll make sure the notes functionality is more available. In the meantime, you can edit an existing entry to add a note. It's also important to know that you can deduct mileage OR gas and maintenance. The deduction rate per mile set by the IRS is meant to include these.

Name: S C
Comments: DO NOT BOTHER, THIS APP IS SLOW AND CRASHES WHEN YOU IMPUT INFO. THE OPERATING IS SLOW YOU HAVE SIT AND WAIT. YOU CANT UPLOAD INFO VIA DESKTOP TO MAKE IT EASIER FOR LARGE UPLOADS
Developer_Reply: Hi, we are sorry that you're having issues with the app. Can you write to us at taxhelp@stridehealth.com? Kindly include a description of the issue you are facing, your Android version, and your app version. We will investigate immediately & solve the issue.

Name: Brian (Blpgifts)
Comments: Keeps losing mileage I dashed for over 5 hour almost non stop today only got credit for about 30 miles put over 130 my vehicle
Developer_Reply: Hi Brian, we recommend recording in 3-4 hour intervals instead. Our data shows that many users start experiencing some inaccuracies after this point. I know it’s inconvenient, but this helps improve the tracking quality. Note we are working towards making this better! We would appreciate it if you could send us details at taxhelp@stridehealth.com.

Name: Roderick Torres
Comments: The app is great but I'm not sure if it's because of the pixelate just having been released but the GPS is not accurate. It logs everything and janky straight lines instead of the actual turns of the car makes
Developer_Reply: Hi there, we're sorry! We recommend recording in 3-4 hour intervals. Our data shows that many users start experiencing some inaccuracies after this point. I know it’s inconvenient, but this helps improve the tracking quality. We are working towards making this better! We would appreciate it if you could send us details at taxhelp@stridehealth.com.

Name: Nick Foran
Comments: Wanna relax on the "are you driving for work" notification? Not everything is about you... tired of seeing this every time I pick up my phone
Developer_Reply: Hi Nick! We understand how annoying that must be. We advise updating your notification settings to stop the constant reminders. Under "Settings," you'll see a page called "Notification settings." Uncheck the "Remind me to track my miles" and perhaps the "Remind me to stop tracking" option so your phone stops sending these notifications.

Name: L Hodgson
Comments: This out works perfect for independent contractors. Trying to keep up with mileage.
Developer_Reply: Thank you so much for your review!!

Name: Lance Nuckolls
Comments: Update: it is working for now. Everytime I launch the app it acts like it's the first time I opened it and makes me type my name and stuff. My data is still there when I get through all of that, but it's annoying.

Name: Carri Childress
Comments: Always double check your recorded mileage on here against your odometer in your vehicle. Almost every single time, this shorts me approx 3 miles. If I doordash 3 or 4x weekly, that's an average of close to 10 miles a week I'm not getting credit for thus its over 500 miles come tax time less than what I truly drive.
Developer_Reply: Thanks for letting us know, Carri! Be sure to adjust your battery settings so that your phone doesn't kill our app to conserve energy while you're driving. Sometimes this causes inaccurate mileage. Please "whitelist" our app in your phone battery settings, and don't hesitate to reach out by emailing taxhelp@stridehealth.com if the problem persists.

Comments: It was great until the last update, please bring back the option to enter our income by weekly basis bcz doing this now by entering the income every day is terrible specially when we use something like Door dash and having many shifts and we have to calculate everyday, doing the income like before once a week is perfect now I'm thinking to switch to another app

You should still be able to see your weekly income under the 'Estimated Taxes' tab. Contact us at taxhelp@stridehealth.com with any questions.

My location is on and the app is updated so I'm not sure why it's not tracking. I'm more than happy to change my 3 stars back to 5 when this gets fixed.
Developer_Reply: Thanks for letting us know. Be sure to adjust your battery settings so that your phone doesn't kill our app to conserve energy while you're driving. Sometimes this causes inaccurate mileage. Please "whitelist" our app in your phone battery settings, and don't hesitate to reach out by emailing taxhelp@stridehealth.com if the problem persists.

Name: David Littleton
Comments: Quick. Simple. Easy to use. Tracks miles well. If I forget to track my miles I can go in and add the miles manually which helps out a lot. I like that I can see my deductions adding up. Makes me look forward to tax time.
Developer_Reply: Thanks for taking the time to leave us a great review, David! -Sarah from Stride

Name: Jeff Rhoton
Comments: Been using this app for about 3 years and absolutely love it. It keeps track of my miles . I can put in my weekly pay and it keeps up with my taxes! Every year when I get my taxes done(H&R Block) the app is right in line and they give it high marks as well!!
Developer_Reply: Thanks for taking the time to leave us a great review, Jeff! -Sarah from Stride

This app is Wonderful! I still write in my notebook -Stride matches my milage notes accurately! Tax deductions are a PLUS! 10★

Name: Jay
Comments: DO NOT USE THIS APP!!! After over a year of using this app I just realized that it does not track your miles accurately. After just doing taxes it makes me sick to think of all the money this app has cheated from people.

Developer_Reply: Thanks for the feedback, Sherry. Gas, along with other car expenses such as maintenance and car insurance fall in the category of actual car expenses, which cannot be claimed alongside the standard mileage deduction. The standard mileage deduction is calculated to be inclusive of expenses like gas, insurance, repairs, etc. -Sarah from Stride

I get home, go to sleep, get up hours later, go to the grocery store, come home, and notice the thing is still tracking my miles.

Name: Kelly Cagle
Comments: Use to work great but now it doesn't track miles properly. I drove 74 miles and it registered as .01 . This has been happening everytime I track now.

It might help to check your phone battery settings and "whitelist" the Stride app so that it can continue tracking your mileage accurately! Please feel free to reach us at taxhelp@stridehealth.com.

Name: Ashley Marchese
Comments: I use both Stride and Gasbuddy.. sometimes even when I'm lying in bed it thinks I'm driving? Both apps at the same time think I'm driving but I'm literally laying on the couch. Lol 🤷‍♀️🤷‍♀️ I don't know what these mileage tracker apps use, but something is not righ.
Developer_Reply: Hi Ashley, we'd love to look into this for you! Could you please email our team at taxhelp@stridehealth with a description of the issue? Thanks!

Name: Amanda Brown
Comments: App worked great, now it's not tracking when not the main screen on my phone. I do not have a samsung phone by the way and have my battery setting's set to accommodate. That's not the issue. Please fix the app!
Developer_Reply: Hi Amanda, we're very sorry to hear that and we'd love to troubleshoot for you! Please email our team at taxhelp@stridehealth so that we can look into this further. Thanks!

Name: Morning Star

Comments: It's a good app to get your mileage tracker, one thing tho: it can't start tracking automatically nor can it stop tracking automatically in an event if you forget to turn it off.

Name: Barb Walter
Comments: Easy tracking mileage expenses and income with estimated taxes. Nice to be able to see a map of your miles for each gig, too. Extra tips and other offers.

Name: Marc White
Comments: This app used to be really good, but since the last update it hasn't worked worth a damn, it keeps shutting off and not tracking my mileage. As a delivery driver I depend on accurate mileage tracking, I've had to start using another app to keep track of my mileage.

Name: Sung Park
Comments: Great free app to track my miles, expenses, and income. Its short of making me a sandwich. Would recommend to anyone driving.

Name: Devon Gibbins
Comments: I forget to track my miles sometimes and it really adds up. Sometimes it asks me if I'm driving for work but it's very rare. I will update to 5 stars once it asks me everytime I start driving, if I'm driving for work.

Name: jshortdawg Short
Comments: This app makes it simple to track your milage. I like that you can add your income from your gig job and get a good idea of what taxes you will be paying. Highly recommend this app.

Name: John Hill
Comments: This app needs to be able to review the map that is available well using a current drive status after you stop driving it would be very convenient to have the ability to see it for tax purposes they require being able to know where you went and for how long you drove and for how far in detail!!!! Comments: Great app, but I would like to be able to split between jobs, right now you can split expenses, but you should be able to split income too

Name: Mariah Encinias
Comments: Pretty good I guess. CON: Theres not a way to organize my driven miles into 2 different folders. PRO: The mile tracker doesn't stop until I turn it off.

Comments: this app is user friendly. Loving how easy it is to track all my expenses, mileage and gives me a estimate of how much my taxes will be due for each quarter.

Name: anely Diaz
Comments: Very convenient way to keep track of miles, I love the mapping! I can't easily see the places I been doing my deliveries during the day.

Name: Paris Wane
Comments: I love that I don't have to keep track of my miles myself, and I got health insurance for my family for cheap! UPDATE: since last update does not track miles accurately. Will not continue to use.

Since you're using a Samsung device, you'll need to adjust your battery settings so that your phone doesn't kill our app to conserve energy while you're driving. Name: Kerry Bennett
Comments: Keeps telling me to update my bank. Everytime I click it, it says my bank is already set up. UGHHHH SO FRUSTRATING!!!

Name: Chris
Comments: You have to sign up and login and all this and that. It doesn't auto track for mileage. I can't click a button each time I get in the truck. No thank you. I way to many things going on to remember one simple thing that others apps already do. It does do a lot of things, but the mileage thing was all I needed from it.

Name: Brandi Lakey
Comments: Makes tracking my mileage & expenses for work so easy! I can take pictures of my receipts when I add expenses which makes keeping up with those so much easier too! This app has taken the headache out of keeping my paperwork organized. Looking forward to having an easier time filing my taxes next year. Thank you Stride!

Name: Justin McNeill
Comments: Such a great app for self employed business owners or anyone who wants help tracking their finances. I'm still new to the app but I've learned quite a few great tips for saving money from tax write offs for my business related expenses, savings through Stride affiliates like 25% off my taxes, plus access to exclusive workshops that offer some great knowledge and advice! You can even log all your milage and expenses and easily export them to make filing taxes less of a headache! Love this app!!!

Name: Scott Hansen
Comments: Works great. It is easy to track miles and add expenses. It is easy to export your deductions at the end of the year as well. Fantastic app.

Name: Paula Howard
Comments: It's a good app. Although when I try to add past milage it does not give me a "save". Looked everywhere for help online and through the help section of the app and still can't figure it out.
Developer_Reply: Hi there! Can you check and make sure you have a job selected within the Settings menu in "My Jobs"? This may be the cause of the issue. If that's not the case, please reach out to our support team at taxhelp@stridehealth.com

Name: Jaime Casarez (Scratch)
Comments: This is my first day using this app and quite honestly. It doesn't work the way it should. I'm missing almost 20 miles of driving. And I see clearly the distance in your app. But 20 miles isn't 4 miles. Please fix this. Otherwise what is the point of your service?
Developer_Reply: We're sorry to hear the app is causing you trouble! Could you write to us at taxhelp@stridehealth.com with more details of your issue? We'd love to help you troubleshoot.

Name: ben clay
Comments: I have been on the hunt for a intuitive mile tracker with more pros than cons and this one sealed the deal for me due to ease of use, driving activated, category for what miles/deductions! Very happy with this app!

Name: Orlando Rodriguez
Comments: Very helpful app for any delivery driver. Just turn it on, start your drive, and it takes care of the rest. Runs in the background as you're delivering and calculates your mileage for when you do your taxes.

Name: Cinnamon Tucker
Comments: I have been using this app since 2019 and its been a game changer! Plus, come tax time, it couldn't be made any easier to have everything presented to me in a clean and easy to read way for me to put in all of my deductions. Also, this app barely uses any battery in the background while I'm working. So thankful for this app. Definitely a must for any gig worker!

Name: Lori
Comments: Simple, fast and easy to understand. Latest version fixes the few bugs and always stays connected now.

Name: Amanda Dunning
Comments: Iv been using since jan now its march and the app isnt tracking my miles.... Iv lost over 400+ miles do to this error. I hope yall can get this fixed! I was loving this app.

Please "whitelist" our app in your phone battery optimization settings; if the issue persists, don't hesitate to reach out to our team at taxhelp@stridehealth.com!

Name: Susan Cadwell
Comments: As an Instacart shopper/deliverer, this app is absolutely essential when it comes time to do my taxes and trying to figure out what my deductions are. I highly recommend this app to anyone who is self-employed as a gig driver; it will make your life that much easier.

Name: Colby Stanford
Comments: Great app and so far, reliable. It is useful for tracking all expenses (not just mileage) and income. I've literally recommended this app to 5 people within the first 24 hours of using it.

Comments: Easy to use and understand! This is a great way to keep an accurate count on your mileage throughout the year, perfect tool for each tax season as a gig worker!

Name: Russ Hill

Developer_Reply: Hi there! You can export your deductions reports to any spreadsheet software by clicking your profile in the upper lefthand corner of the home screen and selecting "send my tax report"!

Name: Suz L
Comments: I like how the app automatically reminds you to start tracking miles, shows your trips for the day, tracks miles & pay deducted. Nothing negative to say.

Name: DgW 77
Comments: This makes it very easy to track your mileage. It gives you live updates on what you can expect to pay in taxes. It allows me to plan for my quarterly taxes. The tax rate defaults @ 30% which is perfect for me as that's slightly more than the 25% that is supposed to be taken out, so it almost guarantees a refund. Love it. Only reason why this is only four stars it's because it does not have my bank listed as an option to link which really kind of sucks because other apps have my bank listed.

Name: Mike Negrin
Comments: It tracks the trip ok but puts duplicates into the app. I deleated 3 extra trips and exited the app. When I went back it put 4 duplicates back in. Pretty hard to keep good records with that happening.

Name: Joshua Compton
Comments: This app is easy to use and ends up being a great experience. Mainly due to the fact they do not spam you with ads and demanding you sign up for special features and use of the app. Not paying a dime but am logging my miles just fine.

Name: Donna Camargo
Comments: Stride is so beneficial for me as a driver for Grubhub. They're calculation of miles and tax deductions are something that was difficult and time consuming for me. To have an app that does that and more for me, is such a stress relief. Thank you Stride!

Name: Nata Grec
Comments: Not counting milage, app started counting, but freeze after. Worked 3 hours, should be about 50 miles, but have only 1.7 miles in the app.
Developer_Reply: Hi Natalia, we're very sorry to hear that! If you could email our team at taxhelp@stridehealth.com, we'd love to look into this for you. Thanks!

Name: It'sMeAlfredo
Comments: Great app for independent contractor. I use it to track my Uber mileage. Super easy to use and understand. You can also use for deductions by linking your bank account. Highly recommend

Name: Chris Carver

Developer_Reply: Hi Chris - if you export your Stride Tax Report you'll be able to see your total miles driven from last year! Navigate to the menu in the upper left-hand corner, then tap "Send my tax report" and select "Get my report", select 2020 as the year, and enter your preferred email where you'd like to receive the report.

Name: N
Comments: Great, but it doesn't sense your driving all the time. Would be great if it had a feature where you coulf set an alarm for it to to open so nothing gets missed. If i drive everyday starting at 900am, it should open and say ready to drive?

Name: Kayla Andruk
Comments: This app is exactly what I needed while I was doordashing! Very educational tool, and helps big time calculating taxes and deductions for the miles I drove.

Name: Carl Hewitt
Comments: I'm a delivery driver for door dash so because I'm self employed I need to write off my miles. This app is perfect turn it on when I leave the house and forget about it til I get home then add my income. Boom shows what I owe in taxes works great!!!!!!!

Name: Anne Contreras
Comments: So far I am loving the Sride app to keep track of my mileage and income. Still figuring out the features, but it is definitely helping me to be more organized. I like how it asks me if I'm driving for work, since sometimes I forget

Comments: This has made keeping track of all my deductions, expenses, mileage, etc. so much easier than trying to remember to log every trip, post every receipt. Great partnership!! Thanks Stride

Name: Janna Dawn Ellis
Comments: Stride is such a user friendly tool for tracking self employment costs and income. Friendly reminders, easy to use trackers, and much more. Highly recommended for driveshare, or self employed workers.

Comments: so far, so good. just been using this app for a few weeks. I have made it through one tax filing and about to start the second. Honestly, it would have been incredibly more difficult to file my income tax without Stride partnered with HR Block. Thanks for being amazing and FREE. DAVID

Name: Rascalava Vang (Rascalava)

Comments: this app is perfect for 1099 drivers. the tax info they give helps very much. the milage tracking seems accurate. this is a must have for all drivers

Name: T. Saldana
Comments: I'm an Amazon driver and this app is easy to use to keep track of those little things that really add up. It's the second week of February and I already have over $400 in deductions. Would've have never guessed. It makes me wish I started using it sooner, especially for gas!

Name: Never Late
Comments: Works well but I do not see any way to print from phone. Need to be able to get paper copy of all data collected by stride app for the whole year. You need to have a paper copy for filling.

Name: Lisa L
Comments: A great app to track mileage & expenses. The only thing that would make it better is if it automatically started tracking miles when you started driving - it's easy to forget to manually start it. But for a free app, it's really good.

Name: Gabriel Quillin
Comments: So I was using Everlance instead of Stride because I 'assumed' it was better. Needless, I transferred ALL data to Stride. I will not go into the why I did it, I'll just tell everyone to do it. Stride is better, period.

Name: Tim R
Comments: Buggy as hell. It will randomly flash because it wants to load adds that won't load then freeze up or crash. Update this!
Developer_Reply: Hi, sorry to hear you’ve been experiencing some crash issues. Please contact us at taxhelp@stridehealth.com and share as much information as you can. We will definitely investigate your case. Thank you for posting!

Name: Fernando Miranda
Comments: So far this app has been operating well for my needs as an independent contractor. No glitch or crashes. User interface is simple and easy to navigate. Overall, I highly recommend. Extremely useful.

Name: Britney Keyzer
Comments: If you keep up with your spending and earnings using the app, it makes life a lot easier to stay organized and get you ready for tax time. I look forward to using this app for a full year this year , to get the maximum savings possible. Thank you Stride :)

Name: theDrake
Comments: It tracks miles well enough, but gives dollar amount totals and not mileage totals. It tracks miles, but to add up MILES driven I had to go to EACH day individually and write down the number and add them up.

Name: Amy Lalonde
Comments: Used this app for the whole year and it tracked everything. Now I can't import any of it into H&R Block. The only reason I used this app was because H&R Block suggested it. And yes, I'm using the correct version.
Developer_Reply: Hi Amy, thank you for your feedback. Your problem needs more detailed examination. Please report it to our technical support team at taxhelp@stridehealth.com. We are always looking to help our users!

Name: Itz Drifter B
Comments: Amazing how it tracks, even when I forget to turn on it asks automatically when I start to drive! Easy to navigate and add expenses. thanks!

Name: C N
Comments: Since the new Android update last week. The app is on but not tracking. I drive all day and realized it hadn't tracked a single mile. Last week some days it didn't track at all, or stopped half way through the day...I'm hoping I can go back and add manually 😑
Developer_Reply: Hi, can you please update to our latest release in the Play Store? This should solve the issue! Please contact us at taxhelp@stridehealth.com if the issue persists. Thanks

Name: Devlin Bowling
Comments: Inaccurate location tracking. Screwed up my miles today while trying to track them.. Other features are cool though.
Developer_Reply: Hi, we're sorry to hear that and would love to solve this issue for you. What version of our app are you running? Updating to the most recent version in the Play Store should solve this issue! Please reach out to our customer support team at taxhelp@stridehealth.com if the issue persists!

Name: Robert Coder
Comments: This is a Great app for the self employed or the side job. Easy to use. it takes all the worries out of trying to figure out your taxes and also gives you tips on navigating 1099.

Name: jean KOHLHOFF
Comments: Like the way it tracks mileage, but it seems to interfer with Google maps and occasionally sends me the wrong way. The problem with interfere seems to have been resolved.

Name: Elden Julien
Comments: Basically a must have for rideshare and delivery. It would be great if there were auto mileage tracking, simpiliar income tracking, and clearer expense categories. Even if they were premium features.

Name: Josue Escobar
Comments: Free version is amazing enough. You can perfectly track your miles. Advice: thank them on you cars dashboard and then add them manually on stride.

Name: Rolando Perez
Comments: Trying to go to benefit tab. But won't let you till you quit the drive tracking app, for which I am currently using right now to keep track of expenses. Now it won't let me update my bank transaction earnings and expenses.
Developer_Reply: Sorry to hear that! Could you write to us at taxhelp@stridehealth.com with more details of your issue? We'd love to help you troubleshoot. Please provide this case ID in your email: 384771. Thank you!

Name: esteban simmons
Comments: The app works great in fine but stops suddenly I require it to work while it's in the background while I'm using other apps while working needs to be fixed to work continuously while in the background I constantly have to look at the app and open the app to ensure that it's working but it would be a great app as long as that is fixed

Name: Pamela Thornton
Comments: I tried to link my bank account but it "took" the top account (I have 4 accounts) instead of the one I tapped on. I went into "manage bank accounts" to fix it and link the proper account but it says "oops something is wrong on our end." I need to link the right account. Otherwise the app is good but there is no way to call or talk to anyone. At least if there is I can't seem to find out how.
Developer_Reply: Hi Pamela - thanks for reaching out! I'm sorry to hear the app is causing you trouble. Our team is hard at work on a new app update to fix this issue very soon! In the meantime, please don't hesitate to reach out to taxhelp@stridehealth.com with any other questions.

Name: Bobbie Behm
Comments: App only works when open and screen is on and even then its glitchy. 90% of my rides just have the beginning 30 seconds tracked and then my phone went dark and when I reopen it at the destination it's literally ine straight line from point A to point B. Does not work.
Developer_Reply: Hi Bobbie - I'm sorry to hear the mileage tracking feature hasn't been functioning properly. Please send an email to our support team at taxhelp@stridehealth.com with a description of the issue and your case ID so our team can look into it! (Case ID: 397549).

Name: Andrew E.
Comments: I like that the app sends notifications asking if I want to track miles. I try to remember, but sometimes in a rush I'll forget to start tracking and it's saved me from starting before tracking.

Name: Srini G
Comments: I am using this app from last 2 days. It's easy to use.but they need to provide every day miles in list. If they put any video about how to use app?. It will get all 5 stars. I don't know they are providing monthly reports & option to send mail its good to have future.

Name: Charmetha Payne
Comments: Drove all day yesterday and today and mileage was not recorded. Drove today for 6 hrs and only 20 miles were recorded. How can I keep up for tax purposes for my gig job. Not useful at all.
Developer_Reply: Hi Charmetha, thank you for your feedback. This doesn't seem right; we want to take a closer look at this for you. Please send a note to taxhelp@stridehealth.com and provide your case ID so we can connect. (Case ID: 397070)

Name: NDN Girl 702
Comments: So far this app has given alot of info on how to save on taxes and health savings also. I have been using it since in an Ubereats delivery and it help with my tax deductions.

Name: Monica Ramirez
Comments: I don't like that it won't allow me to change my pay week dates to match my actual pay periods. It throws my records off. Wish it had an option to choose your own pay dates NOT an automatic set of dates....

Name: eric bragg
Comments: It's horribly inaccurate. I tried it for a week and it hasn't been close yet. Today I drove 130 miles it tracked 70. Useless app.

Name: joshua caruso
Comments: So far I love this app. The gps signal says it falls off every now and then even though my gps still guide's me to my destination without a problem. I'm also using another app just in case this one tries to charge me at the last minute when tax time comes.

Name: Kelly Munsey
Comments: App has been having issues since 12/2020. Not logging miles. Have to go back and manually load at the end of each day. May have to switch apps if this is not fixed. Can't be manually loading miles the rest of the year.
Developer_Reply: Hi Kelly, thank you for your feedback; our team is hard at work on a new update to resolve the issue. In the meantime, please feel free to reach out to our support team at taxhelp@stridehealth.com and provide your case ID so we can look into the issue further! (Case ID: 396540)

Name: Brendan Lyons
Comments: I use this for tracking my deductions with instacart and it has helped me immensely keep track of what I should be saving! It really makes things a whole lot easier for someone who hasn't always been the best with finances.

Name: Jonathan T.
Comments: The mileage tracking is great! Some more work on integration and a more intuitive interface would make this a 5 star for sure!

Name: Scott Zelenik
Comments: The app worked for a day and then when you hit the "I'm done driving " button the app crashes. Even after reinstalled
Developer_Reply: We understand how annoying that must be. We are working hard on an update to resolve the issue. In the meantime, please feel free to email our team at taxhelp@stridehealth.com and provide your case ID so we can keep troubleshooting! (Case ID: 396064)

Name: Tina Martin
Comments: This app is perfect for helping me keep track of milage and taxes! It even reminds me to track miles if I didn't start the tracker when I start work. I love this app!

Name: Tanji
Comments: Great for tracking income and mileage and helps in giving you an estimate on the amount you owe in taxes. I use it to track mileage for DoorDash as a Dasher.

Name: Chrystal Sprague
Comments: Enjoy getting the deductions and seeing it in real time! Easy to use even recommended it to other drivers who didn't know about it!

Name: justa koolmthafcka
Comments: The very first day i even tried stride i had driven 47 miles. I get home, check what the app says, the app says 13. If it can manage to miss over half of a trip. No way im trusting it to get smaller trips right.

Name: Steve Fisher
Comments: Stride mileage always worked fine but since the first of the year it is not tracking my miles correctly so far I have lost out on over 200 miles that have not been logged. I can't figure out what's wrong

Name: olga lowery
Comments: Excellent job for tracking miles, just wish this app would recognize "drive mode" without manually selecting "start a drive"

Name: Isaiah O
Comments: Can't Add Expenses. The save button doesn't work on any of the "Add Expenses" on the Galaxy S10+. Its grayed out on all of the categories. I tried doing it from my desktop, but there is no way to add expenses on there.

Name: Gary Banks
Comments: I appreciate the fact that this app has worked most of the year. But it hasn't tracked my milage in a month. This is sad I needed that mileage. But I think im going with everlance now.

Name: Dexter “sexy dex” Cameron
Comments: Tracks mileage very good but it would be nice if every time you move it would ask if its for work. Many times 1 or 2 hrs later that notification comes on. Also when battery saver is on and I run the app I have to disable but when its automatic and I select yes for work I don't need to.

Name: Dawn Moss
Comments: Love this app.! I open it up before I start driving for door dash and it keeps track so I can have an axial mileage deduction for tax time. Helps find other benefits too, such as, catch. com.

Name: Gabrielle
Comments: I rarely search out apps on Google Play to rate them--only if they're really good or really bad. This app is REALLY good! If you are self-employed (I do Doordash) this app is essential. Helps me keep track of deductions and estimated taxes I'll have to pay. Glad I won't be surprised come tax time with a huge sum I owe, got this all organized.

Name: William Mendoza
Comments: App was working great until this week, the App no longer tracking milage unless the app is running on the screen. This cannot be possible since running a business requires to have multiple apps running and cannot have this app running alone on the screen. If this issue is not fixed I will need to look for another app.

Name: Shannon Oubre Coles
Comments: Not tracking my miles. I've used a few of these apps in the past with no problem auto tracking. Even with insurance company apps. I have checked settings. This app doesn't even recognize that I am driving. I have to go back and add many drives.

Name: Katina Roberts
Comments: Best it can be for free i suppose. Wish it was automatic so i wouldnt forget to start it, but has a feature to add later.

Name: William Torres
Comments: This app makes my life so much easier as an independent contractor...with a little set up and information you'll wanna make sure you have this on at all times. Also I like that it knows I'm driving and notifies me if heading to work or not.

Name: Scott Guidry
Comments: Very quick and easy way to keep track of work mileage and income. What I like most is that it'll remind me to track mileage once movement is sensed.

Name: Oliver Prior
Comments: Great, makes it SO easy to track expenses, income and mileage. Couldn't ask for something more simple and practical.

Name: Edward Chavez
Comments: At the moment I give it a 4 only because I haven't used it for tax purposes just yet. However it works great, runs in the background and reminds me when I forget to activate it. If all goes well for taxes I will up it up to 5 stars

Name: Graham Stegall
Comments: I love how self explanatory Stride is. It's helpful to have the taxes section and adding income totals so you can keep it documented. I enjoy it.

Name: Cisco YMD
Comments: No longr works in the background, for a long time it did start to work again. Recently, I believe to the latest update is that the app no longer tracks my mileage. I tried to see if the app location permissions just need to be changed but it seems that run in the background permissions isn't there

Name: Torre Nibblett
Comments: Easy to use and a great way to track everything related to driving for a living. I like how the app can tell I'm driving and asks me if it's for work because I forget to turn it on. Great app!

Name: 4RealSailor
Comments: Pretty much does as advertised. Excellent at keeping track of mileage. I think I had maybe one hiccup; but, they informed me that was going to happen ahead of time. As long as I report my wages it estimates my tax liability. Thank you team.

Name: sean kenney
Comments: Easy to log miles. Often sends me a notification to ask if I am driving for work whoch I like. I can add expenses and income as well. Good app.

Name: Arland Jones III
Comments: I like how it's easy to use, but I can't access my linked accounts so I have to input everything manually including receipts, bills, retirement funds, insurance. Speaking of insurance, the app doesn't link to it at all. Oh, and no technical support exists at all!

Name: Carlie Moran
Comments: I LOVE this app. Keeps track of all my miles and even alerts me to start a drive if I don't remember to start it myself. It also has the option to keep track of all my other expenses and everything! I love it!

Name: Juli Conforto
Comments: I use this to keep up with my mileage and income as an instacart shopper. A good way to reduce your taxes at the end of the year. I like that when I start driving it ask me if I'm driving for work or not so I don't forget to turn it on

Name: Mic Breeze
Comments: When I file my taxes I'll give an updated review.. Hope it all works out okay with H&R block.. I have been having trouble manually adding miles from before I used the app.. Hopefully that gets fixed soon and we'll give 5 stars.

Name: Blake Coy
Comments: Been using for a few weeks now haven't had any problems with it.. I still personally write down all my miles down in a note book cause this is a app and you never know if it will go down

Name: Carl Kearse
Comments: This app burns through my battery. Having this app open with the delivery app is problematic. It can cause glitches in other apps too. This app also glitches when manually putting in the income and deductions.

Name: Jennifer Morelos
Comments: Very accurate. I always compare it to my vehicle's odometer and its spot on every time. I use it for doordash.

Name: Courtney Norod
Comments: This app is life changing for tracking your expenses and income! There are no gimmicky things and the fact that it's free blows my mind. Thank you!

Name: Billy Gill
Comments: App is great does what you need it to do also free version is GREAT so far. Hopefully it stays great going forward. Keep up the good work👍

Name: Mike Hays
Comments: This app won't allow me to stop extraneous, and useless notifications, like a lot of junk on the web. I'm writing this review, because there was no other way to contact stride without digging through their website. I just wanted to track my miles! I may have to go back to a notebook. Or maybe there's something else that won't tell me about every last financial possibility that can exist in my life.

Name: Llenar Bragg
Comments: So Far So Good UPDATE 11/30/2020: This used to be a good app. Now, when need to add mileage later, cannot put in starting and ending address to get mileage. Bummer

Name: ian brown
Comments: Fantastic app for tracking milage and tax deduction! Pop-ad free as far as I've seen so far. Been using for 2 weeks now. No real extra wear on my battery that I can tell either.

Name: David McLeish
Comments: Used to have an option to add forgotten miles where you typed in a start address and finish address and the app calculated the distance. The fact that the feature is gone now is an aggravating drawback and takes you extra time now to figure it the distances for yourself.

Name: that1dude0092
Comments: Very useful way to track my mileage when I do deliveries. Just wish it can auto stop when it notices I haven't moved for at least 30 minutes so it can stop tracking. If you do doordash, postmates, or anything similar, this app will be your friend when tax season starts.

Name: Bridget Taylor
Comments: Only once did it not record miles. Pretty straightforward, gives great tips, helps as best possible. Would recommend to any driver!

Name: stressedman “el mechanico 13” 13
Comments: Very glad I found this tracks my miles every single time I leave for work and as I am always on the clock while I drive even when I forget sometimes to turn it on it reminds me so very helpful like it

Name: Wayne Floyd
Comments: Does the job it was intended for. Helps you track deductions and gains easily. As well as keep your business spending records in order.

Name: Michael Anderson
Comments: It's awesome. I can close it and focus on active orders, and it still tracks until I say stop. Love it!

Name: Cammie Grevemberg
Comments: I use this to track my mileage and add paychecks. It does the expenses for me and tells me what to set aside for taxes. The only think its missing is a tracker for the odometer. It just tracks miles with no odometer reading. But, this is a real good app.

Name: Ronald Stewart
Comments: It's a solid 4 star app when things work. My bank information hasn't been able to update for the last two weeks so I haven't been able to notate my expenses; still waiting for someone from customer service to reach out.

Name: Paul
Comments: Too many garbage notifications and no way to turn them off. I don't mind ads that's cool but I hate notification ads. That's unacceptable.

Name: Amy K
Comments: Occasionally my miles do not track, for whatever reason, and I have to manually enter an estimate. It sucks because tracking miles is the only reason I have it. But it works 90% of the time and it's a free app so I can't complain too much.

Name: Guanajuato Estrada
Comments: Using this app to track my miles while doing Door Dash, so far it's good you can keep track of miles, car expenses, personal expenses and taxes.

Name: JAmie Tompkins
Comments: This app is absolutely rhe beat for keeping track of all your mileage and helps you to save the money you need to have for tax time. Lots of tips and help options to go to find out information that may be over looked.

Name: Rick zeak
Comments: Been using this app for about 3 weeks now. I really dont have any complaints at all. Really easy to track miles and other tax deductions and give you an estimate of what you will owe for taxes. Haven't had any issues with the app at all.

Name: Eric Johnson
Comments: Everything works as expected. I can't express how much easier this app makes recording once and mileage. I will update it to 5 stars once I am ABSOLUTELY CERTAIN that the tax information is accurate. So far everything works as expected.

Name: Jordan McGrew
Comments: All of the sudden mid drive it ads 25k miles and says I went to a random country and back. I don't have a VPN active so I am not sure what is causing it but the app is now unusable for me.

Name: Tyler Miller
Comments: Someone from your company needs to contact me NOW. All my past miles are gone from the app. You are costing me money. I need my past miles restored immediately. I want a log so I can upload it into an app that actually works. I will pursue legal action if I don't get a response.

Name: Deshane333
Comments: I love the ease of use tracking time and mileage. This makes doing quarterly and yearly tax deductions simple and easy.

Name: Samuel George
Comments: Your app doesn't track the miles correctly in the Fairview heights,il region you guys need to fix it asap. I've turned this in more than once.

Name: Doug Ray
Comments: I have been using this app for a few months and love it. I sometimes forget to turn it on/off but it reminds you to turn it on, just not off. Great app, can't wait until Tax season to see how accurate it is, will update then.

Name: Carol Jones
Comments: Just started using this app in the last year. I haven't filed any taxes yet but so far seems to keep great track of mileage and deductions.

Name: Yves Calixte
Comments: The app is incredibly easy to use and it doesn't crash while you're driving; I also like its features which allows you to add expenses and manually input your mileage.

Name: Dave Vidissimo
Comments: It's exactly the tool I need while driving for my service on the clock. I look forward to viewing the tax form generator. I haven't tried it yet.

Name: Judith Shone
Comments: As soon as i turn on uber i turn on STRIDE it is so easy and beats tracking on paper. During tax time STRIDE emails the mileage to accompany my return...no guessing but official..love it!

Name: Nicholas Ramkissoon
Comments: So far a very intuitively designed system. Easy to traverse and pleasant. Only issue I have is that the tracking when your driving function is very spotty. Otherwise a great tool.

Name: Daniel
Comments: Great app, helpful for tracking mileage and income. 4 stars because occasionally app can't save data and mileage is lost.

Name: Nick Myrick
Comments: Works okay. Doesn't always keep track of mileage as driven but more so "as the crow flies" between places. Like it because it estimates tax deductions

Name: Kristin Rolon
Comments: Really great app for keeping track of miles, especially if you forget to write the odometer down. Really like how it helps give an idea for what taxes could possibly be, without being greatly surprised.

Name: Mel Guzman
Comments: Just started using this app, wish I knew about it 2 months ago when I started driving. Very easy, pretty much like clocking in and out of work.

Name: Reuben Royal
Comments: Perfect. The app is so easy to use, and prompts you right when you start driving. Extremely easy to start for ride-sharing and food delivery. Highly recommend.

Name: Steve Scott
Comments: Poor accuracy. 50 miles on my car, 21 on the app. But it could be because I have to keep restarting my phone due to severe instability caused by another app. Have followed Strides fix-its to no avail.

Name: Sabree Ali
Comments: As long as I don't forget to turn the app on. I am always in good shape. What I appreciate is when the app inquire if I am driving for business

Name: Charles Morman
Comments: Very good, almost perfect. Never had any issues tracking miles or expenses. I wish you could manually set your tax rate since their 30% estimate is too low.

Name: thatguykahuna
Comments: So far liking it. Trying to get the hang of it, but, overall, the ui is sleek and navigation is easy to go through.

Name: Matt Drazkowski
Comments: Love this app for tracking my miles when I use ride share apps. Plus it tracks your estimated taxes u will paying. Overall great app easy to navigate through and use in general.

Name: David Spain
Comments: Simple convenient app to record mileage and expenses. I'm sure I don't use it to its full ability, but I use it to auto-record my mileage for DoorDash and to estimate my taxes for that 1099 job. It saves your data too to the cloud, in case you have to get a new phone.

Name: Mark Reis
Comments: It is about the same as keeping track on paper. You have to start and stop the tracking manually, annoying but okay. Where it falls short is the categories. Why mileage trackers don't have a custom category that you can type the tittle, I don't know.

Name: Rasheed Babikir
Comments: Nothing to say seriously. It looks like very useful but have not got enough time to go deep in to find out more about it but I will try to learn more about it very soon. as the new year is by corner. Thanks for all your suggestions and the efforts that trying to make me successful!

Name: Hector Toledo Jr.
Comments: This is an excellent App. I use it to track my mileage and all of my expenses for my business, and at the end of the year I can print out a detailed report. What more can you ask for from a free App. Awesome!

Name: Karah Sanders
Comments: Recently this app has failed tracking miles consistently. It used to work great and now I di l can't even see any of my mileage after I stop tracking my miles which means I'm going to have to Google all my trips and calculate miles which means probably a week off of work just to do this. I would not recommend this app anymore!!!!

Name: John Law (CataclysmicLAW)
Comments: Very useful and user friendly, helps keep track of expenses for work as well as mileage and any supplies you need, and provides an estimation of savings and possible returns. definitely recommending to friends and family.

Name: Katharine Graham
Comments: Great for tracking tax documentation. I feel much better prepared this year than I ever have. Adding expenses is a little cluncky, especially the receipt part. But having everything in one place will be a life saver in April!

Name: Laurie Parker
Comments: It's a pretty simple app to use for mileage tracking. The main page is pretty busy, butnonce I saw and began to use the app it is easy to use!

Name: Tonya Johnson
Comments: Keeps track of mileage and even walking as long as on your person. But wish it would remind you of when back to starting place to see if done like it does when you start the car.

Name: Christopher
Comments: I wish I could attach a picture. Ever since the update, it has been really confused about my miles. Apparently I drove 33,000 miles in 40 minutes!!! Must be a world record. I have not changed phones or anything, so I am not sure why I'm driving through the ocean

Name: Tracy
Comments: This app is fantastic. If you're working in app delivery and you aren't tracking your miles, download this right now and put it right next to your driver app. I cannot scream about it from on top of a mountain enough.

Name: Cathaleen Hansen
Comments: This app is wasting my time. It double inputs my dives sometimes so then I have to figure our how to remove the extra one and then it doesn't track some of my drives even though I tuned it on. I'm going into switching to something else.

Name: l. S.
Comments: This is a piece of garbage app. Not user friendly. I would not allow me to insert milage from last week. Even today milage, it does not except. Do not waste your time with this low grade app. Moreover, if you drove and record mileage, it will drain your battery. I am not sure why Strides, wants to link bank accounts?

Name: Grace Grossman
Comments: Way better then all of the apps I've tried. I do door dash and it's highly recommended for that platform. It's simple to use and more reliable.

Name: Tiffany Ferguson
Comments: I love how accurate the mileage tracker is. I've tried other apps where the tracker is off by a few miles and I didn't like that but I don't have that problem with stride. I also love that they give advice about filing taxes. Been using it for a few months now and will continue to do so.

Name: hunniebunnie
Comments: This app has been very helpful in tracking my mileage. If I forget it offers solutions which are very helpful. I would highly recommend to anyone who drives.

Name: Ms. Dee
Comments: Love the app! However, I would like to have the option of pausing my mileage. This would be a great feature to have. It would allow people to resume mileage that is counted towards work.

Name: Racheal Ayala
Comments: It has been great. No problems yet.could use some more features. But overall great. Oh also, it needs alil faster response time to your driving time, like when it alerts you if your driving for work or not when you forget to start it. But all in all great app

Name: Amber K
Comments: Every single time for the past few months when I try to add income it says there's an "error on our end." When will this be fixed? Also, DO NOT apply for health insurance, it is the biggest rip-off I've ever seen! It doesn't cover anything for the first 3 years, and the prices are ridiculous. Just go to the marketplace, you can find actual coverage there.

Name: S.Eric Miles (E.MMWW)
Comments: Inconsistently works no way to merge data (import/export) in other formats. Useless as a midyear app, , insuffient for general accounting and flexible to meet multicar or capturing data mileage only and assumes .575 per mi is the only expense to track and browser or pc version purely a applet and not a serious application. Primary function is to sell other programd.

Name: Nicholas Torres
Comments: I used to love this app as i drive for work. But upon checking my milage this morning i see that nothing has been saved since june. I use this app 5 to 6 days a week every week. Now i have to figure out how many miles im missing thanks to this app not saving the miles i am tracking.

Name: Food “Appetizer” Eater
Comments: Stride is the best! And helping me keep track of what I make and what I owe. and always asks me when I'm driving if its first ride for work. I absolutely recommend this app if you use your personal vehicle for work!

Name: Alicia Meyers
Comments: Great to use for driving gigs. I love how easy it is to track your mileage. And it estimates your taxes, which is helpful.

Name: Rob Anderson
Comments: App has helped me immensely in tracking my miles for independent contract work. Makes my life a hell of a lot easier! Great app

Name: José V
Comments: It was working fine until today. I set it up, then go out to start driving for my job. I find out at the end of the day IT DIDN'T TRACK ANY OF MY MILES FOR THE ENTIRE DAY. This is a big deal considering I need to know the mileage to get reimbursed.

Name: Jozia Sr
Comments: I download the app a week ago to help track on my mileage before doing Uber Eats and doordash deliveries but now it just crashes literally 100 times a day and and even open the app at all. It's literally crashing and isn't even open or operating it's weird. And now I've lost all my tax information for the past couple of days or technically the past week. I want to try and reinstall it but I'm worried about losing my current information so hopefully something will happen like an update.

Name: Stephanie Oddo
Comments: Very easy to use, gives you alot of pointers and also gives alot of offers that can help secure your future if anything happens! Very pleased so far with outcome 😀

Name: Linda Thomas

Name: Debra McCabe

Name: Melissa Brangan

Name: Jon More

Name: Allison Rollette (zythia13)

Name: gene woodcock @@

Name: sean fuller
Comments: Seems to be a very good app, easy to use, I like it, a big help from anyone that drives for a living, and other benefits too, check it out

Name: Precious
Comments: I haven't filed my taxes yet, but so far so good, the app is really easy to use and makes me more financially aware. This will be my first time filling taxes on my own and working in general , I'll update when I file my taxes to see if the app is really worth it.

Name: Susan Rose
Comments: I am having the same problem. I recently did a phone reset and when I installed stride and signed in, I get the Start tour screen then get stuck on "enable physical location". Please help!!!

Name: E Morales
Comments: I've yet2 used a single perk from Postmates that I have been able to tap into and enjoy the fruits of my labors. These services stride has available currently, are all top priorities I've not yet completed this year. I'd really like to see a very competitive Auto insurance that's affordable which will better assist me with any vehicle maintenance issues that will 100% take its cours. • I just need someone to help me reduce my monthly Auto payouts •I need to file my taxes •file stimulus check

Name: Barbara Alldredge
Comments: So handy. At the push of a button, your tracking miles. I am a delivery man for Doordash, and Grubhub. It's really great to be able to press one button, and boom, we're tracking. It's nice to know how much deduction too. It tells you right on screen. LOVE IT!

Name: Demetrius Brown
Comments: It tracks your miles... fine... what bothers me is the app is for an insurance company but does not make it very easy to access ways to USE your insurance. Not even the web site helps. I have dental and vision but it keep asking me to look at options to enroll in both. I need a dental check up, should get a list of businesses or doctors that accept Stride. This has been an issue since last year... i should of spoken up sooner. Now with covid everywhere it's even harder to get help.

Name: Terry Creamer
Comments: Oof. I can see how this app is very helpful if updated on a daily basis, or you have a need to track miles. I downloaded it so I could classify transactions from tax year 2019. It turns out categorizing a year's worth of transactions is basically untenable in the app. The only filter on loaded transactions is for "suggested deductions". No date filters, no text search on the loaded transactions, nothing. One filter, that ends up not finding anything because Stride didn't have any transactions to suggest. Okay, that's fine, I'll scroll through my transactions and flag them as I see them. Well, it becomes clear why they can't have the filter features pretty quickly. Maybe twenty transactions at at time are loaded when the user has scrolled through the previous twenty transactions. However, if I select a transaction, categorize it, and navigate back to the list of transactions, all of the transactions I scrolled through need to reload, twenty at a time, before I get back to oldest transaction I had just categorized. In other words, you always start scrolling at the top with your latest transaction first, even if these transactions had been previously loaded a few seconds prior. Okay, understood, maybe I just need fewer transactions to scroll through, so I'll connect fewer accounts. Well, this is borked too. Personal transactions were being loaded into my list of transactions when I hadn't connected those accounts. I don't know if that's Stride, Plaid, or my bank that I have business & personal accounts with, but without Stride providing any useful filtering capability and loading only twenty transactions at a time categorizing previous transactions is made very tedious. This issue was made EVEN WORSE because *duplicate* *personal* transactions were appearing in my transaction list. Like, I paid for Netflix once in one personal account I hadn't connected to Stride. Why am I scrolling past five Netflix transactions on the same date?? Terrible. I concede maybe due to privacy and security concerns caching transaction information increases Stride's exposure to data leaks of third party content, however the duplicative transactions combined with superfluous content amassed in drips by a stop-and-go endless scroll experience make categorizing past transactions with Stride a worse option than it was created to replace. This was my initial download because H&R Block is able to import transactions from Stride (apparently). Unfortunately, categorizing past transactions in Stride is more ardous than entering each transaction manually into the H&R Block interface. I'm a new user that was enthused about Stride's import capability with H&R Block that has been completely disappointed with Stride's utter disregard for categorizing any transaction that hasn't happened in the last few days. Besides this app being an blatant sales shell to Stride's other services, several fundamental features for classifying transactions are missing. Using a Pixel 2 with Android 10, I'm curious if the experience on an Apple product would be better. Without even a transaction web interface to compare with, I'm stuck presuming this is the best Stride can do. I can see how folks that expense a significant amount of car travel on a near-daily basis would find this useful. They probably would categorize their transactions daily too and wouldn't deal with having to scroll through a year's worth of transactions to categorize some of them. However, for any historical categorization over the course of a tax year on Stride's initial download, Stride is unequivically a failure. Two stars because the app probably works okay for some use cases. For my use case Stride is disappointingly useless. Fingers crossed I hear of improvements, but I'm not expecting any given it's clear Stride Tax prioritizes a bare bones beachhead of use cases to exist as marketing shell.

Name: zach lafave
Comments: Great app, very smooth. The only improvement would be a desktop or web based access to modify transactions.

Name: Chris R
Comments: This app makes it very easy to keep track of mileage for self-employment delivery jobs as well as having the added bonus of tax savings suggestions so that you aren't blown away by what you owe at the end of the year. There are many useful options in this app and it's definitely user friendly.

Name: Zebediah Cooley
Comments: Started doing Doordash to pay for college and I was really worried about managing my own taxes, this app makes it really nice and simple to do without begging you to pay for a subscription. Highly recommend!

Name: David

Developer_Reply: Hello Amanda, we have published a new updated version today 4/26/20  that has the fixes required by Google to remedy the issue. Please update your app or uninstall and reinstall.  https://stride.fyi/app-update

Name: A Google user

Thanks to Stride's interest in my healthcare choice, I was able to secure an affordable plan by simply following their step by step guidance.

We recently learned that a recent update to Android devices like yours is automatically disabling location tracking to save battery life, and that interferes with Stride's ability to track your miles properly. Just email us at taxhelp@stridehealth.com and we’ll help you adjust your phone’s settings so that your miles get tracked.

Name: A Google user
Comments: Uses HUGE amounts of your cellular Data plan.  Over less that a month period Stride Tax used 1.5GB of my cellular data while tracking my Uber and Lyft driving.  Now, both Uber and Lyft also track your miles yet these two apps only used about 200MB of data each accomplishing the same goal.  I contacted Stride Support and their response was typical of Customer "Service" in today's world.  They couldn't explain why their app was using  7X as much data as either Uber or Lyft's own tracking software. They suggested I try "turning off other apps that I'm not using".  Brilliant.  If your not on an unlimited plan it might be less expensive to use a paid tracking program than paying for Stride to burn through this amount of data.  And absolutely no way of knowing what exactly are they streaming off my phone to account for that amount of data.  Until I get an educated and respectful response from Stride my review is 1 star.

Developer_Reply: The app does have automatic notifications that will remind you to start your drive, but there are a few settings that need to be in place in order for you to receive them: Whenever 1) you are moving faster than 5mph, and 2) your phone is plugged in and charging, you'll receive a notification reminding you to start your drive. I hope that helps!
